title: How to Cut and Paste on Photoshop

steps.title: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse.
steps.content: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse. You can cut things such as text, images, or shapes from your Photoshop document. If there are multiple objects you want to cut one layer, press Ctrl + A (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + A . [1] X Research source If you want to select more than one object at a time, you can press and hold Ctrl (PC) or ⌘ Cmd (Mac) and click the other objects.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+X (PC) or ⌘ Cmd+X (Mac) to cut.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + X (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + X (Mac) to cut. The selected object is copied to your clipboard and removed from the project.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V (PC) or ⌘ Cmd+V (Mac) to paste.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + V (Mac) to paste. The copied object is pasted into your document.

steps.title: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse.
steps.content: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse. You can cut things such as text, images, or shapes from your Photoshop document. If there are multiple objects you want to cut one layer, press Ctrl + A (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + A . If you want to select more than one object at a time, you can press and hold Ctrl (PC) or ⌘ Cmd (Mac) and click the other objects.

steps.title: Click the Edit menu.
steps.content: Click the Edit menu. It's near the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Cut.
steps.content: Click Cut . The object will copy to your clipboard and disappear from the project.

steps.title: Click the Edit tab.
steps.content: Click the Edit tab. You’ll see this above your project on Windows and on the top of your screen on Mac.

steps.title: Click Paste.
steps.content: Click Paste . The object will appear again in your project.

steps.title: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse.
steps.content: Select the media you want to cut with your mouse. You can cut things such as text, images, or shapes from your Photoshop document. If there are multiple objects you want to cut one layer, press Ctrl + A (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + A . If you want to select more than one object at a time, you can press and hold Ctrl (PC) or ⌘ Cmd (Mac) and click the other objects.

steps.title: Right-click on your selection.
steps.content: Right-click on your selection. A menu will appear next to your cursor.

steps.title: Click Cut.
steps.content: Click Cut . The object will copy to your clipboard and disappear from the project.

steps.title: Right-click on your selection.
steps.content: Right-click on your selection. A menu will appear next to your cursor.

steps.title: Click Paste.
steps.content: Click Paste . The object will appear again in your project.
